data.title: The 100 Best Movies With Call in the Title
data.meta_description: The 100 Best Movies With Call in the Title, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: Margin Call, Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans, Call Me Bwana
data.text:
How many movies with call in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with call in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with call in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with call in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with call in the title include One Missed Call, Margin Call, and The Call, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the call movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Kevin Spacey, Paul Bettany, Jeremy Irons

Released : 2011

Directed by : J.C. Chandor

Expertly capturing the dramatic tension and high stakes of the 2008 financial crisis, Margin Call is a powerhouse ensemble drama that showcases an all-star cast including Kevin Spacey, Paul Bettany, and Jeremy Irons. The gripping narrative centers around key employees at a large investment bank, scrambling to contain the fallout from a potential disaster as they uncover significant financial discrepancies in their risk analysis. With its sharp writing, engrossing performances, and realistic portrayal of corporate greed, Margin Call stands as a relevant critique of the modern financial industry.

Released : 2009

Directed by : Werner Herzog

Nicolas Cage delivers a powerhouse performance in this gritty crime drama as a morally compromised New Orleans police officer struggling with addiction, personal demons, and the weight of his responsibilities. Directed by visionary filmmaker Werner Herzog, Bad Lieutenant: Port of Call New Orleans weaves a dark and twisted narrative that blurs the line between right and wrong, serving up a harrowing portrayal of one man's descent into chaos. With its visceral storytelling and unforgettable characters, this gripping film showcases the darker side of human nature, leaving a profound impact on those who dare to venture into its murky depths.

Bob Hope, Anita Ekberg, Edie Adams

Released : 1963

Directed by : Gordon Douglas

Starring Bob Hope as a bumbling but lovable writer mistaken for a skilled African explorer, Call Me Bwana is a hilarious screwball comedy filled with slapstick humor and memorable one-liners. Hope's knack for comedic timing and physical comedy is masterfully showcased as he embarks on a madcap adventure through the African wilderness, filled with exaggerated action sequences and larger-than-life characters. This riotous romp remains a favorite among fans of classic comedy.

Fan Bingbing, Annie Yi, Huang Shengyi

Released : 2007

Directed by : Zhang Jianya

This endearing romantic comedy tells the story of a recently divorced middle-aged man who, after seeking relationship advice from a bestselling book, finds his ideal partner through a series of unconventional phone calls. Call for Love handles the complexities of modern relationships with wit, charm, and sensitivity, featuring a standout performance from its engaging lead actor. As a delightful and heartwarming exploration of love and companionship, this exceptional film resonates long after the credits roll.

Released : 1970

Directed by : Gordon Douglas

Sidney Poitier reprises his iconic role as Virgil Tibbs in this gripping crime drama, which sees the San Francisco homicide detective unraveling a complex web of deceit and corruption following a murder investigation. Balancing raw emotion with high-stakes action, Poitier's captivating portrayal of the determined and resourceful Tibbs remains a standout in the canon of cinematic detectives. A compelling tale of ambition, vengeance, and justice, this sequel to the groundbreaking In the Heat of the Night further cements Poitier's status as a trailblazer in Hollywood history.

Released : 1950

Directed by : Frank McDonald

Set during the height of the Yukon Gold Rush, Call of the Klondike is an engrossing adventure film that follows two ambitious prospectors determined to strike it rich in the untamed wilderness. Blending breathtaking scenery with heartrending human drama, this captivating tale skillfully portrays the perseverance, camaraderie, and rivalry that defined the era. A rousing testament to the indomitable human spirit, Call of the Klondike is a thrilling trip back to a bygone era.
